As a matter of principle, I never give a game 100%... it just seems wrong, as no game is perfect... however, it is almost impossible to criticise anything about portal, apart from possibly its short length. Has to rate among the top games I've played.... EVER!

This is one of the most interesting games of its time. Its new its fresh and its fun. If you like games that change the market you'll like this one with the portals as your weapon using your surroundings to complete tasks becomes your objective. If you like storylines with cool of swings and secrets you'll find this is the game for you. The only thing going against this game is the puzzles as I have found many people that don't like puzzles or get frustrated when they cant complete a task other than that one of the best games of all time and should go down in the history books filed under the top ten.

Perfect...just perfect. Valve have created this rather unique, and rather funny masterpiece that is Portal. The gameplay is incredibly unique, not just in the puzzle genre but of all videogames in general. And a brilliant well-written and very funny narrative and antagonist complementing it even more. GLaDOS - one of the best videogame villains ever. It's a bit short, but I don't see that as a criticism, more of it not outstaying its welcome. Perfect length for a perfect game.

One of the best puzzle games I have ever played. I admit the storyline is a bit lacking imo but I still find this to be a great game and lots of fun. Just recently got Portal 2 and loving it especially fun in the co-op with your friends. This series is definetly worth checking out if you like puzzle games.

Different And Really Fun
game story short but so fun and challenging if playing for the first time.

A puzzle game with personality.  The little details and the dialogue are hilarious.

Only drawback: flinging yourself through multiple portals may cause slight motion sickness.

A very cool and unique game. You create two portals with the 'portal gun' to complete challenges and objectives. The game has an immersive story line and the graphics are beautiful.

The drawback to this game is that if you don't have patience in solving puzzles you probably won't like it. Also the main story line only provides around 5 hours of gameplay.

Worth the £6.99 in my book.
i found it to be a short game... but thats me... but still a great game

I love everything about this game, except for the part where you have to kill GLaDOS. I'll play through the entire game in one sitting, up until that part. I love the backrooms feel, and the ambient music is perfect for the setting. 9/10, only because you have to kill GLaDOS.

"I can't think of any criticism for it. I'm serious, this is the most fun you'll have with your PC until they invent a force-feedback codpiece. I went in expecting a slew of interesting portal-based puzzles and that's exactly what I got. What I wasn't expecting was some of the funniest pitch black humor I've ever heard in a game. OK, it's only two to three hours long, but that's a good length for it, it means that it doesn't outstay it's welcome, and it narrows the gap between you and the balls-tightening fantastic ending. Absolutely sublime from start to finish and I will jam forks into my eyes if I ever use those words to describe anything else ever again."
---Ben "Yahtzee" Croshaw

This is the only completely positive review that Yahtzee ever gave to a video game, and that says a lot.  Every word of the above quote is true.  Such a good game.  If you haven't played, then you've been missing out on life.
Good fun game.
lò finito in 1 giorno è una merda è faciliccimo spero che il secondo sia + lungo xkè questo era cortissimo

Was kann man da sagen?Kurz, billig, gut.Was will man ,mehr für das weniger Geld?Es ist allerdings ein kleines bischen wenig anspruchsvoll, aber das kommt auf den Menschen an, ich kenne Leute die da ewig festhingen.

PCGamer magazine called Portal "the number one game of all time". I have to agree with them. There is simply no other game with as unique a concept or great a challenge. Although lacking graphical polish, Portal still is in a class by itself with its unique gameplay and mind-bending puzzles. Coupled with Gameinformer magazines' number one character of the decade (Glados) and probably the most difficult achievement ever (Aperture Science), Portal is enough to make puzzle lovers drool, but really anyone who tires of shooting things up will enjoy this game--a must play for any hardcore gamer!

Portal is an excellent short game that innovates both the puzzle solving and third person shooting genre. The game is evenly paced, so the game is a learning experience rather than a frustrating one. The best part about Portal is that it utilizes the source engine, which allows user created materials to freely flow around the internet waiting for you to download and play. You have to use both your lateral thinking and cognition to decide where the portals should go. In most cases there isn’t multiple ways to solve a portal puzzle, but they are designed so meticulously that your brain will pick it up immediately after a quick analysis. After beating Portal I actually felt smarter, can’t say that about my intelligence after playing games like Call of Duty.
An entertaining first person puzzle game, a little light on content but great fun.
it is good

Portal represents my favourite type of puzzle game - you have to use your brain, but you also need quick fingers. In some levels there is more then one way of getting to the end, one usually favouring thinking and the other dexterity. The puzzles themself are very innovative, variable and overall excellent.

What sets this game apart from almost all other puzzle games is its story aspect. It is thoughtfully expanding the already existing Half-life universe without damaging the canon.
But most importantly - Portal gave birth to one of the best villains in video game history! 

Portal could have been a little longer but thanks to the community (and Valve for great support of modding in all their games) you have plenty of interesting maps even after you finish the original campaign.

There is only one VERY bad thing that's worth mentioning:  [spoiler] The cake was a LIE! [/spoiler] 

[b]Rating: 9.5/10 [/b]

Game Rating: 9.5/10

[h1]Challenging but rewarding puzzles and one of the best villains of all time.[/h1]

[b][i]Portal[/i] is the 1st game in the Portal series, which is a spin-off of the Half-Life series. It's a first-person shooter where your gun allows you to link two locations with portals. Send objects or yourself through portals to solve a series of physics puzzles in the mysteriously empty Aperture Science Laboratories, all while under the instruction of the abusive AI, GLaDOS.[/b]

Some of the puzzles in Portal can be difficult, but are extremely gratifying when you manage to figure them out. The use of portals and the Portal Gun are so creative and unique that almost everyone has heard of Portal before. There's a real build-up of mystery and intrigue as you go through the test chambers, which culminate in an action-packed finale. The star of the show is GLaDOS, the facility's AI which "guides" you through each of the tests, whose true personality and ulterior motives are hinted at throughout the game. Overall, Portal is a great experience. However, the game is rather short, and doesn't have a lot of replay value.

Definitely pick it up and play it at least once. If you're unsure, get it on sale, since it usually goes on sale for pretty cheap.

[h1]Overall Enjoyment:
4/5 — Great[/h1]

I'm now writing this recommendation in 2012. It's a shame it took me so long to get back into PC gaming because I've been missing out on this gem since 2007. It's worth mentioning too, that a game 5 years old has captivated my attention like Portal has. 

There isn't really any game I can compare Portal to, I've never played anything quite like it. At face value Portal is simple. You shoot a portal, you shoot another portal, you go through them, game over. Not quite. Portal's levels are fun, engaging, challenging, pleasing to look at, and there's quite a mysterious little story with characters you'll grow to love, or love to hate. 

I beat the entire game in roughly 5 hours, so keep that in mind when you're getting your wallet ready, but remember that this game was initially included in the Orange Box, and wasn't meant to be a full blown stand alone game. With that being said, Portal is worth the couple of dollars that Steam wants for it. Highly recommended.

In my personal opinion: I didn't like Portal as much as it's sequel mostly because it's chambers are more "stopwatch" centric, requiring careful timing, patience and careful thinking. Of course this is relatively minor as Portal is much better known for it's own unique brand of humor that has been quoted for years after it's release. There isn't really much else to add here, as I relatively disliked Portal in general. Still to everyone else it remains a classic title that no fool on Steam should not have, because of all the times it was free in the Steam store.
Awesome game, fun puzzles and a fun experience!
